entry.title: Re: S4HANA SPS Update SDMI (Silent Data Migration) CL_NGC...
entry.content:
Hello,

Had the same issue: resolved it following this note:
3597327 - The SDMI (Silent Data Migration) CL_SDM_QM_STXH finished in client XXX but XXX new entries are found that are still/again valid for migration
You need to execute a migration class again after it has been finished. 
1)Reset the status of the migration class in transaction SDM_MON -> button Current Client info -> Edit -> -select class->Restart finished Migration
2)Execute report R_SDM_ONLINE_EXEC with the following parameters:

Name of migration class : (Class in question)

Max. no. of parallel threads      =          4

All checkboxes must be unchecked!

Then initialise the phase again.
Hope this helps

Thanks
Neerja Sharma

entry.title: Re: S4HANA SPS Update SDMI (Silent Data Migration) CL_NGC...
entry.content:
Hello,
Had the same issue: resolved it following this note:
3597327 - The SDMI (Silent Data Migration) CL_SDM_QM_STXH finished in client XXX but XXX new entries are found that are still/again valid for migration
You need to execute a migration class again after it has been finished. 
1)Reset the status of the migration class in transaction SDM_MON -> button Current Client info -> Edit -> -select class->Restart finished Migration
2)Execute report R_SDM_ONLINE_EXEC with the following parameters:

Name of migration class : (Class in question)

Max. no. of parallel threads      =          4

All checkboxes must be unchecked!

Then initialise the phase again.
Hope this helps

Thanks
Neerja Sharma

entry.title: Upload failed "Permitted file size exceeded" despite file being < 5MB (HCMFAB_MYPERSONALDATA_SRV)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I am currently trying to create an Action Project in SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA) by uploading an API specification from an SAP On-Premise system.

The Scenario:

  • Service: Standard SAP HCM Service HCMFAB_MYPERSONALDATA_SRV (Metadata).

  • File Format: .xml (renamed from .json to ensure correct parsing).

  • File Size: 3.1 MB (on disk).

  • SBPA Limit: The UI states the limit is 5 MB.

The Issue: When uploading the metadata.xml file, I receive the following error message:

"Invalid File. Artifact information could not be retrieved.. Permitted file size exceeded. The file must not be larger than 5 MB."

My Analysis: Technically, the file is well below the 5 MB limit. However, this specific OData service is very large in terms of schema definition because it contains EntitySets for almost every country version (e.g., PersonalData01, PersonalData02 ... up to PersonalData99).

It seems like the internal parser in SAP Build crashes or times out due to the sheer number of entities, even though the physical file size is within limits.

Question:

  1. Is there a hidden limit on the number of entities/complex types for the Action Editor?

  2. Is there a recommended way to "pre-filter" the metadata file (e.g. only keeping PersonalData01 for Germany) without manually hacking the XML structure and risking syntax errors?

Any help or workarounds are appreciated!

Best regards, Daniel Eckstein

entry.title: Re: Extra licence for Scope Item 1RK?
entry.content:
Dear @MelanieG,

Two important points for Public Cloud:

1.1RK is being replaced in release 2508, SAP states that scope item 7MI is the replacement for scope item 1RK

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/ee6e1bd4c69f46ad8f653434326f2b8e.html?version=2508.00

So in CBC scoping you should plan to use/activate 7MI rather than 1RK

2.License / extra subscription for most customers, mass maintenance / mass load for BP is not a separately priced add-on it’s typically part of the Public Cloud capabilities

More details from SAP for Me:

 

SAP Note below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/3646136


The definitive way to confirm for your customer contract is to check whether the scope item is flagged as license-dependent / requires additional S/4HANA Cloud license in the Availability and dependencies of scope items list used with SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC)

I your case NOT extra license

SAP describes this exact check in Note below:

 https://me.sap.com/notes/0003539934

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Report Recurring Pay - Multiple rows in Story Report
entry.content:
Hi community 

I am creating a story report to provide periods and amounts for an employee in Recurring Pay. I have created the report based on the standard report SF_COM_Recurring_Pay_History_v2.0. 

The result for a Time Range splits the Pay Component into multiple rows, but I would only like to have a new row if the amount has changed. If the amount is the same I would like effective start date of the first row and effective end date of the last row. 

Below you see current output which has 2 rows due to another change in Compensation Information as of 01/09/2025:

My goal is to have only 1 row with effective start date 01/08/2025 and effective end date 31/12/9999. The example above only have two rows but there could be even more rows, where it should then have effective start date of oldest record and effective end date of newest record which might be in the future.

How do I achieve this result?

This question is similar to a question raised in 2024, but there are now clear answer to this question. 
Multiple lines in story report for compensation - SAP Community

Does anyone have a resolution for this, or maybe some links to documentation on how to do this. 

Thanks,

entry.title: Time Recording in SAP Project System with CATS (1) -Time Recording to WBS Elements
entry.content:
1.   Introduction

In most project-based organizations, accurate tracking of time spent on project work is essential. Many companies use Cross-Application Time Sheet (CATS) to enable employees to enter their working time on assigned tasks for detailed time recording. The integration between Project System (PS) and Cross-Application Time Sheet bridges the gap between project execution and actual time tracking, ensuring that human resource effort is reflected in project actuals and confirmations automatically.

Time recording allows project cost tracking and budget control, provides input for capacity planning and resource utilization analysis, and ensures that actual effort and progress are visible in the Project System.

Project System provides two structures: work breakdown structures (WBS) and networks. Depending on your project needs, the project structure can be designed using either WBS elements, networks, or a combination of both. Due to the fundamental difference between WBS elements and Network structures in SAP Project System, where WBS elements serve as planning and cost control objects, and Networks (with activities) serve as operational execution objects, the behavior of time recording and cost posting also varies accordingly.

In this blog series, we provide scenario-based demonstrations of end-to-end processes, including

  • Time Recording for WBS element,
  • Time Recording for Network Header,
  • Time Recording for Network Activity/Element

together with the “Project Builder” and “My Timesheet (S/4HANA / Version 4)” (F3074A), which is available as of SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01.

Project Builder and My Timesheet Fiori Apps

This documentation includes the prerequisites for enabling the integration and a step-by-step guide for the first scenario - Time Recording to WBS Elements (the other two scenarios will be described in the upcoming blogs). Both planning and execution phases are addressed in each scenario. The goal of this documentation series is to provide users with an overview of the integration between PS and CATS, and to help them troubleshoot when setting up the integration in their own systems.

2.   Prerequisites

This section outlines the foundational configuration and master data required to enable time recording and cost posting to Project System objects. While some prerequisites apply to all scenarios, certain details may vary depending on processes.

2.1   Activity Type

Activity type is a unit of measurement for a particular activity, like Machine, Labor, or Maintenance. In the context of Project System (PS) with CATS integration, an activity type is a prerequisite in scenarios where internal labor needs to be planned using activity-based cost planning or where actual cost posting is required for WBS elements and network activities (with confirmation).

You can create an activity type using transaction code KL01 and maintain its price with respect to a cost center using KP26 for activity price calculation. Additionally, you can assign a list of activity types to a work center in the Costing tab under Activities Overview.

2.2   Work Center

A work center in SAP represents a physical or logical resource where project work is carried out. In the context of Project System (PS) with time recording, Work center is a prerequisite for activity-based internal labor cost planning, for person assignment in network activities, for automatic worklist generation in CATS, and for capacity planning in network activities.

You can create a new work center using transaction CR01 or make changes to an existing one using transaction CR02. For time recording to different object types in Project System (PS), different work center settings are required. 

For activity-based internal labor cost planning, the work center must allow usage (Usage setting) in network activities, and a cost center must be assigned. One or more activity types should exist with prices maintained in KP26 for the same cost center assigned in the work center. A standard value key is required to define measurable effort (e.g., labor time), and a corresponding formula must be assigned to convert effort into duration and cost.

For capacity planning and evaluation, the Capacities tab of the work center must include a capacity category (e.g., labor) and a defined available capacity (typically in hours per day), which is used for scheduling and overload checking. A formula must be assigned to calculate the available capacity. The standard value key is also required.

For person assignment in the network, optionally, you can link employees to a work center through HR assignment. HR resources can be assigned to a work center via HR assignment. In the Person Assignment tab in a network activity, when the checkbox Only from w/p is activated, only persons who are linked to the assigned work center (via HR master data) can be assigned to the network activity.

2.3   HR Mini Master

You can maintain a subset of core HR infotypes using SAP HR Mini Master by creating personnel using PA40 with the corresponding action type (Infotype 0000) or by using PA30 to maintain infotypes for existing personnel. These core infotypes enable an employee to interact with the system for time recording, person assignment, and other functionalities.

For time recording to (Project System) PS objects, you must set up the HR Mini Master with the following infotypes:

  • 0000 (Action Type),
  • 0001 (Organizational Assignment),
  • 0002 (Personal Data),
  • 0105 (Communication).

Optionally, you can define the default cost center and activity type for time entry in Infotype 0315 (Default Values Time Sheet). When performing capacity planning in network activities, it is recommended to set up the Infotype 0007 (Planned Working Time) to enable accurate capacity evaluation against working schedules.

2.4 CATS: Data Entry Profiles

The CATS Data Entry Profile (configured via transaction CAC1) defines the behavior and UI of the time sheet entry screen. In the My Timesheet Fiori app, employees can switch between available entry profiles using the Switch Profile button, allowing different configurations for different use cases.

Default Values

Default values reduce manual input by automatically populating fields such as:

  • Controlling area
  • Activity Type
  • Receiver Cost Center

These values can be derived from the HR Mini Master (Infotype 0315), the work center, or the profile itself. If no default exists and no user input is provided, cost transfer may fail due to missing costing information. 

Worklist Settings

Worklist generation is used to propose relevant project objects (e.g., network activities) to the user when recording time.

The following checkboxes influence this behavior:

  • With Worklist: enables the Worklist tab in the My Timesheet app or GUI, allowing users to select assigned tasks (such as network activities/activity elements with person assignment).
  • From Resource Planning: includes assignments from Workforce Planning (transaction CMP2). Ensures that employees see activities assigned via capacity planning.
  • From Project Assignment: includes network activities with direct person assignments made in the Person Assignment tab of the network activity/activity element.
  • Customer enhancement: standard worklist generation supports only network activities/activity elements with person assignments. To extend this (e.g., for WBS elements), implement BAdI CATS_WORKLIST_ADDIN. The BAdI allows you to define custom logic for generating worklist entries per user.

These options must align with how planning and person assignment are done in your project setup. For example, if your resource assignments are maintained only in PS (not Workforce Planning), the second option may be unnecessary.

Configuration in the example CATS entry profile

Integration with Project System (PS)

To ensure the integration with PS:

  • The profile must allow transfer to PS (e.g., via program CAT5 or RCATSTPS).
  • The activity type, receiver object (WBS/Network), and cost center must be valid and consistent with Project System settings.
  • The network or WBS element must be released (REL status) and allow actual postings.

Approval

If approval is required:

  • Enable the Approval Procedure in the profile.
  • Define who the approver is via workflow rules.
  • Time entries must be approved before they can be transferred to CO/PS.

Approval setting in the example CATS entry profile

2.5   Authorization and HR Integration

Authorization

Users must be assigned the appropriate authorization roles to access and operate the CATS (Cross-Application Time Sheet) and Project System (PS) integration features. This includes:

  • Authorization to use specific CATS data entry profiles.
  • Authorization to record, approve, and reverse time entries.
  • Authorization to execute time transfer programs (e.g., CAT5, CAT7).
  • Access to related master data (e.g., WBS elements, network activities).
  • Authorization to view and analyze cost and confirmation data in PS.

Ensure these roles are correctly assigned through your security/authorization team before starting the time recording or transfer processes.

Integration

ALE (Application Link Enabling) is only required if your HR system is separate from the controlling/PS system (distributed systems).

3.   Scenario A: Time Recording to WBS Element

In PS, you may want to record time directly to a WBS element when your project requires cost tracking at a high level, without the need for detailed operational execution via network activities. WBS elements do not support person assignment or capacity planning. Therefore, worklists are not generated for employees in their timesheets. Instead, employees must manually select the WBS element when recording their working time using CATS.

This demo walks through the complete process of recording time to WBS elements in SAP S/4HANA Project System (PS), including cost planning, time entry via My Timesheet Fiori app, cost transfer, and actual cost analysis.

3.1   Project and WBS Element Setup

We created a project (DL-BAD.015) in Project Builder with three WBS elements with high-level cost planning. In the WBS element, we can, e.g., plan high-level costs related to capacity using Easy Cost Planning (ECP) or manual entry. Cost planning for WBS elements in DL-BAD.015 was performed using transaction CJ40. The detailed planning process will not be covered in this session as it is not the focus of this discussion.

WBS elements are structured as follows:

DL-BAD.015.1 – Requirement Analysis

DL-BAD.015.2 – User Training & Rollout

DL-BAD.015.3 – Testing and Validation

When creating WBS elements, you need to pay attention to the following configurations:

Set the Planning Element indicator to allow cost planning.

Set the Account Assignment Element indicator to allow actual postings (e.g., time, material).

These are indicators that can be found in the Project Builder Basic Data tab for WBS elements.

Project DL-BAD.015 (Project Builder) PE: Planning Element Indicator; acct: Account Assignment Element Indicator

Cost planning for WBS element DL-BAD.015.1

To enable actual postings, the project must have system status REL (Released). Otherwise, time entries will be blocked.

Release the project

Example: Attempting to record time against a WBS element while the project is in status CRTD (Created) results in an error. 

Error when recording time to a non-released project

3.2  Create an Assignment in the My Timesheet App

When recording time to a WBS element in the app, you can either create a new time entry manually every time or create a reusable project assignment for the WBS element.

The latter option improves efficiency for recurring tasks. To create an assignment, go to the My Timesheet Fiori app, click on the Assignments button on the top right. The following fields are mandatory:

  1. Receiver WBS Element: must be a valid account assignment element.
  2. Activity Type: derived from HR Mini Master Infotype or defaults in CATS profile (see 2.3, 2.4); if not, the user must enter it manually. If it does not exist, no cost can be calculated from the activity type rate.Select the WBS element DL-BAD.015.1 as the Receiver WBS Element for assignment creation

In the example, it is derived from the default activity type from HR Mini Master Infotype 0315. Furthermore, the activity type must have rates maintained in KP26 (see 2.1).

3.3 Record Time to WBS element

From the Edit view of the My Timesheet app, open the value help dialog on a specific date and select the assignment just created. Enter the number of hours and check the entry. If the check is successful, click on Submit. If an approval workflow is active (defined in the CATS Data Entry Profile, see 2.4), the time must be approved before transfer.

My Timesheet app Edit view

Select assignment from value help dialog

After the check is successful, we can submit the time.

Time entry is auto approved

3.4 Transfer Time Records

Till this step, the cost has not yet been transferred to the controlling (CO). Use report RCATSTCO or transaction CAT7 to post time entries. A log is posted indicating that the transfer was successful.

In the example, transfer time entry to CO is performed only for relevant example employee

Transfer to Controlling successful

3.5 View Posted Costs

The screenshot shows that an actual cost has been posted to WBS element DL-BAD.015.1 (Requirement Analysis)

Planned and actual cost for WBS DL-BAD.015.1 is highlighted (CN41N)

3.6 Record Time with Manual Activity Type Entry

As mentioned earlier, the activity type is read from the HR Mini Master. If no default activity type entry exists, you can manually assign it. To do this, edit the time record entry, enter an activity type that is valid for the employee’s Cost Center (price must exist for the activity type with respect to this Cost Center, see 2.1).

Edit activity type manually

By following the same procedure as 3.2-3.3, two actual costs are posted to WBS. You can review costs, e.g., by using the Project System Infosystem or the Project Cost Fiori apps. In this example, we can view the cost using the following apps:

  • CN41N – Project Structure Overview with Planned/Actual comparison.
  • CJI3N – Display Actual Line Items for WBS.
  • KSB5 – Display Cost Center Line Items by Activity Type.
  • S_ALR_87013532 – plan/actual/variance overview in SAP Project System

Two costs posting for WBS element DL-BAD.015.1 (CJI3N)

Planned and total actual cost for WBS DL-BAD.015.1 is highlighted(S_ALR_87013532)

Actual cost document for activity type Consulting (KSB5)

Actual cost document for activity type Assembly (KSB5)

3.7 Reverse Time Postings

To reverse an incorrectly posted time entry, first withdraw the approval (if an approval workflow is active), then delete the entry in My Timesheet and rerun CAT7. The system will automatically create a negative posting to reverse the original cost.

Negative cost posted for WBS element DL-BAD.015.1

This scenario concludes with the WBS element receiving actual internal labor costs from time recordings. At this stage, the project team can continue monitoring actuals against planned values, perform any required adjustments, and, if applicable, proceed with period-end closing or settlement activities. This completes the time recording cycle for WBS elements and sets the stage for further financial control and reporting in Project System.

entry.title: Automatic Payment Run Identification in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Each automatic payment run generates a unique identifier for the proposal. Is this code stored in the accounting document of the payment so that it allows tracking which invoices were cleared?

When reconciling the payment, I cannot find any identification that stores the batch of automatic payments to be able to search for it.

In other words, I would like to know if the system stores the batch number or any identifier in the accounting entries of automatic payments to facilitate the search and reconciliation of remittances with multiple invoices.

Does anyone know anything about this?

entry.title: Significant Performance Degradation in SAP BPA UI Automation Steps when Targeting SAP HANA Cloud UI
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are experiencing a sudden and severe slowdown in our SAP Build Process Automation bots that interact with our SAP HANA Cloud web interface. All UI-related activities (e.g., Click, Set Element, Get Element) are executing extremely slowly, taking 10-20 times longer than usual. However, non-UI automation activities within the same project (such as Excel operations, file system activities, and loops) are executing at normal speed. The issue is strictly confined to the interaction between the BPA agent and the target web application.

Please provide your suggestions and insights on this issue we are facing.

Thanks in advance

Needs to display in Ageing order.  I have used prefix with number like 1,2,3 etc...though order not coming properly.

entry.title: Re: Create GOS attachment from xstring document
entry.content:
Hi Missschaaa,

Add the OBJECT_HEADER parameter in Function Module , it will work

* Add the OBJECT_HEADER parameter in Function Module , it will work


t_objhead = VALUE #(

  ( line = |&SO_FILENAME={ lv_file_name }| )

  ( line = |&SO_DESCRIPTION={ lv_obj_descr }| )

  ( line = |&SO_FORMAT=BIN| )       "Important

  ( line = |&SO_FILEEXT=png| ) "png

  ( line = |&SO_OBJLEN={ lv_doc_size }| )

).



CALL FUNCTION 'SO_DOCUMENT_INSERT_API1'

    EXPORTING

      folder_id                            =  ls_fol_id

      document_data              =   ls_doc_data

      document_type              =   'PNG'

*      document_type              =  'jpg'

    IMPORTING

      document_info              =  ls_doc_info

    TABLES

      contents_hex                 =  lt_solix

      OBJECT_HEADER              = lt_objhead

    EXCEPTIONS

      folder_not_exist           = 1

      document_type_not_exist    = 2

      operation_no_authorization = 3

      parameter_error            = 4

      x_error                    = 5

      enqueue_error              = 6

      OTHERS                     = 7.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR ls_doc_info-doc_id IS INITIAL.

  MESSAGE 'Failed to insert attachment' TYPE 'E'.

  RETURN.

ENDIF.

entry.title: MRP-RUN : STR ( stock transfer requisition) cansidred as depend Requirement befor approval
entry.content:
Hi,

I am facing an issue.

In our current project, the MRP strategy is based on special procurement. MRP generates a Stock Transfer Request (STR).

Manufacturing plant (1003):
When MRP runs, it generates a planned order. After that, we manually convert the planned order into a Purchase Requisition (Stock Transfer Request to the distribution plant, i.e., the supplying plant) using MD15.
These STRs are subject to a release strategy.

Distribution plant (1008):
MRP generates a Purchase Requisition based on the depend requirement generated from the manufacturing plant (1003) as an STR (Stock Transfer Request).

Requirement:
The dependent requirement in the distribution plant should be considered only for the Stock Transfer Requisition has been approved.

Current situation:
The system considers the planned order generated in plant 1003 as a dependent requirement in the distribution plant.

same for the STR NOT APPROVED 

Question:
How can we configure or handle this scenario in the system to ensure that only approved STRs are considered as depend requirement in the MD 04 of the distribution plant

I would like to set the property of a standard field to be filterable, but when I save the change, I get an error message that can't add more than 50 standard fields with search-relevant.

As displayed above the system has already 78 standard fields with Search-Relevant, so how can be possible to add another one?

And as seen, no custom fields are been used to any of those proprieties.

Are we required to unselect 29 of those ones just to add 1.

Wouldn't that afterwards remove the possibility to search by all the ones that were deselected.

And does anyone knows what this message stands for:

Since there's no documentation on SAP sites to really understand what this message means and how to interpreter it.   

Wish you all a nice day, and if you could help me, would be appreciated.

Regards,

Eduardo

While I see the option to debug in Simulation step, there is no way I could see to debug the earlier steps. 

Note that the App Analyze Your Selection Process does not support the Fixed Asset Mig. Object. 

Any pointers, please ? 

Regards

AJ

entry.title: Create a Automated Recurring Task in SAP CALM
entry.content:
I would like to know if it is possible to create an automated monthly task in SAP CALM and assign the task to a predefined user. The next step would be to create an approval workflow for the task.

The requirement is to auto create a task at a defined period, assign it to a processor and then send it for approval to a supervisor . Based on the approval, the next step is completed and the status is set to complete.

Is it better to use a different feature in SAP CALM other than tasks to achieve this . For eg: Something like an IT Calendar?

entry.title: SAP Screen Personas – Control Personas Button Visibility Based on RF Screen Field Value
entry.content:
Hi Experts,
I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – EWM RF Environment and using SAP Screen Personas to enhance an RF screen.

I have added a custom Personas push button (Print HU) on an RF screen, but when i made the custom flavor default i could see this custom button on each screen of this application as below

The requirement is to show this button only when “GR Posted” = X on the same RF screen.
Screen details
• RF screen program: /SCWM/SAPL_RF_RECEIVING_HUS
• Screen: 0501
• Field GR Posted is a display-only text field, captured via recording as:
wnd[0]/usr/subx:/SCWM/SAPL_RF_RECEIVING_HUS:0501/txt/SCWM/S_RF_REHU_HU-PGR
• Custom Personas button technical ID (from recording):
wnd[0]/usr/btnPersonas_XXXXXXXXXXXX

What I tried
In the onLoad Personas script, I am reading the value of the GR Posted text field and toggling the button visibility

My questions
1. Is this the correct and supported approach in Screen Personas to control visibility of a Personas button based on a display-only RF field?
2. Is there a recommended best practice to Custom button visibility/ Custom persona flavor applicability based on existing screen field values
3. Any limitations or risks in S/4HANA Public Cloud RF environments I should be aware of when using this approach?

System Information
• SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
• EWM RF Environment
• SAP Screen Personas (Flavor & Scripts)

Thanks in advance.

Phani Deepthi A

entry.title: Joule for SAP SuccessFactors: How to get started?
entry.content:
How to ensure a successful start with Joule for SAP SuccessFactors? Join this webinar to learn more!

Joule is an AI-powered technology that delivers a copilot experience using natural language processing. Joule offers informational, navigational and transactional pattern to assist you with various tasks across SAP SuccessFactors products. Based on your requests, it provides real-time information in response to your queries or automates tasks so that you can complete them directly on the conversational user interface.

In this webinar we will explain how to implement Joule. We will guide you through the pre-requisites. How you can check if you fulfil the pre-requisites an we show the most important steps you must follow for the implementation. We will show you the steps partly in the system and will highlight the most common issues during implementation. After the session you know what you must fullfill and how to implement Joule on your own.

Register here

entry.title: Re: Implementing SAP BTP Secure Login Service for SAP GUI - enabling SSO and MFA with corporate IdP
entry.content:
Hi @MatthiasL ,

Thanks a lot for the detailed feedback and for taking the time to try this configuration out - much appreciated.

Regarding the issue where everything looks correct (SNC + CCL parameters, cryptolib) but it still doesn’t work: from experience, when it works on one system but not reproducibly on others, the root cause is often partner name resolution. In particular, mismatches between the SNC name expected by the ABAP system and what the registry side actually presents (for example due to hostname vs FQDN differences, case sensitivity, or changes in the secure login client configuration) can cause exactly this kind of behaviour.

On the parameter naming: the correct one to use is
ccl/snc/server_partner_name_mapping_for_SLC_only
OR
ccl/snc/server_partner_name_mapping_SLC
as per the SAP note 2338952.

And thanks for the heads-up on the table formatting issue as well — you’re absolutely right about the hidden scroll bar. I wish I would fix the readability issue as well but I lost the access to my previous community user account. I would rather publish new blog including all the changes.

Thanks again for the feedback!

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - BW ODP Delta via Replication Flow

entry.title: Datasphere (DSP) and SAC data and metadata versioning / backup and restore
entry.content:
Background:

Contrary to BW f.e. where full Versioning of all objects is available. Data backup directly of requests on the file-system/logical path (not SARA, but also SARA can be used). DSP and SAC have no such out-of-the-box solutions (except a handful of DSP objects). 

SAC: offers no Versioning nor Data protection 

DSP: Versioning exists for: Tables (including Remote), Views, Models, Task Chains, DACs, Replication Flows, Transformation Flows. Restore is possible only for: Tables (local only, not remote), Views, and Models. What is not versioned at all: Data Flows.

 

What exists is: Full DB backups (DB-Snapshots with RedoLogs) - Platform Backup: 

SAP: 

  • DSP and SAC Tenants: SAP creates a daily backup with 15-minute intervals for RedoLogs, but this is for disaster recovery and is not available to customers. These backups are retained for 14 days.
  • SAP HANA Cloud offers Back/Restore of the entire DB (daily plus 15-minutes RedoLogs) for 1-215 days.

3rd party (DB-snapshots):

  • Data Lakehouse (Databricks) - Connect Databricks and integrate the data into the Amazon S3 layer. Use Amazon BackUp feature, but full DB. 
  • Google's Data Cloud - Same as Databricks, but data will be in stored on Google servers instead of Amazon S3.

 

Solution/steps:

SAP Suggests pushing the data to a separate tenant - requires more admin overhead and added costs for the 'backup' tenant or creating content packages with data. 

 

Alternatives for Data backup:

#1 Push data via Replication Flow into a separated DB (create a connection to own DB / costs compared to S3, Google, separated DSP tenant are negligible). Replication Flow can export data (this is the PI/EAI/EDI functionality of DSP), Replication flows may require additional costs, but backups can be run during off-peak hours.

#2 Pull data via OData to separate DB (f.e. Azure Data Factory - create Linked Service, Create Connection, where you specify the DSP Space.View/Table, create Dataset and 'SINK' the data - suggestion is to drop and recreate the table to avoid errors when the DSP view/table structure changes)

#3 Store data in local tables - These tables would be in a separate space. Tables need to be set to disk (not in-memory), as you do not want the memory footprint to be expanded unnecessary. Least efficient alternative. 

SAC Planning data can be pushed to DSP via CDI connection (if Native is used) and then backed-up. In case of Seamless planning, the data is already in DSP stored. SAC Actuals data are expected to be acquired from DSP in our case. 

 

Alternatives for Metadata backup:

DSP and SAC via transport files -> Via CLI an automated script can be created (as of now there is no automated export job available). 

DSP offers versioning for: Tables (including Remote), Views, Models, Task Chains, DACs, Replication Flows, Transformation Flows. What is not versioned at all: Data Flows. 

 

Restore: 

SAC -> transport files. Just re-deploy into your DEV tenant and thus 'restore' the f.e. Story in the version you need. Helps a lot as complex stories with complex Java-Scripting tent to get corrupt - f.e. lose the model information. 

DSP -> Restore is possible only for: Tables (local only, not remote), Views, and Models. Everything else is only transport files. 

're-transport' is also possible from TST or PROD tenants back to DEV tenant of course.

 

References

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/0c3780ad05fd417fa27b98418535debd/ae2b2b7117c84b0aab670ddd2f...

https://help.sap.com/docs/hana-cloud/sap-hana-cloud-administration-guide/backup-and-recovery

https://me.sap.com/notes/3491324

https://me.sap.com/notes/3574161

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/43509d67b8b84e66a30851e832f66911/586699519c83489bb778878236...

 

Main blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/bw-vs-datasphere-dsp-amp-sac/ba-p/1428...

entry.title: Re: SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
@BinWang thanks for the offer.  But we got it sorted out.

The documentation above has some errors and is not complete.

1. The way via "Manage Destination Certificates" on BTP doesn't work, because you cannot import the CSR from STRUST

2. We needed to add the ECS proxy to the service (don't forget the allow-list SR). 

3. Step 6a is misleading. It says "

  1. Target System Settings: In the Host field, enter https://proxy.<your region>.hub.j4a.services.sap. As Protocol, select HTTPS." --> it's import to NOT have the HTTPS:// infront...as shown  correctly  in your screenshots

4. Create a separate PSE in STRUST. The cert needs to be created by ECS and signed by SAP CA. Should look like this:

The certificate list in the PSE must include:

CN=DigiCert Global Root G2, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
CN=DigiCert Global G2 TLS RSA SHA256 2020 CA1, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
CN=DigiCert TLS RSA4096 Root G5, O="DigiCert, Inc.", C=US
CN=ISRG Root X1, O=Internet Security Research Group, C=US
CN=SAP Global Root CA, O=SAP AG, L=Walldorf, C=DE

Cheers,

Mark

entry.title: Re: Emarsys Api: How to retrieve all outbound emails sent...
entry.content:
Hi,

One option could be to use Webhook nodes within Automation Programs.
In each Automation Program where emails are sent, you can add a Webhook node right after the “Send Email” step. When the contact reaches that node, Emarsys calls your endpoint (for example, SAP CPI or an API), and from there you can create an “Email sent” activity in the SAP Sales Cloud timeline.

This is aligned with the standard documentation on Creating Webhook Node Presets for Automation Programs: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/b165581b13de40869ce7b59db65abb52/01faf5b5e33c47cba5d31037776bbdd3.html

Best Regards.

Fernando.

entry.title: Re: Emarsys Api: How to retrieve all outbound emails sent...

In each Automation Program where emails are sent, you can add a Webhook node right after the “Send Email” step. When the contact reaches that node, Emarsys calls your endpoint (for example, SAP CPI or an API), and from there you can create an “Email sent” activity in the SAP Sales Cloud timeline.

This is aligned with the standard documentation on Creating Webhook Node Presets for Automation Programs.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/b165581b13de40869ce7b59db65abb52/01faf5b5e33c47cba5d31037776bbdd3.html

Best Regards.

Fernando.

entry.title: Re: Launch of RISE with SAP Methodology & Experience Certification for Senior Roles
entry.content:
Exploring a New Evaluation Experience with AI

Recently, I had the opportunity to participate in an evaluation that went beyond selecting predefined options. This approach allowed me to integrate real aspects of my work—even in presales—and assess how effectively I’ve applied key concepts. It also provided clarity on areas that require reinforcement, supported by explanations and actionable suggestions.

One of the most notable features was the interaction design. The AI offered a friendly and approachable tone, supported multiple languages (I chose Spanish for the first time), and enabled follow-up questions whenever the intent of a question was unclear.

The feedback extended beyond technical accuracy. It included observations on tone, posture, and clarity, along with recommendations to simplify explanations and improve communication. This holistic perspective transforms the evaluation into a learning experience rather than a simple test.

Of course, it remains an evaluation, and even in a role-play scenario, the challenge of staying relaxed under assessment is real. However, the depth and quality of feedback make the process valuable and insightful.

entry.title: Re: Como solucionar No task List Selected IW322
entry.content:
Hi,

Please check below points:

1. The task list should be relased and active when the order is generated

2. Do not delete the task list while processing the maintenance plan

If the error still persists please try creating new task list and maintenance plan.

Priyanka Mishra

entry.title: FINCS_MD_CONSUNIT118 – “No accounting source ledger is maintained for version P11” during Individual
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m facing the following error in SAP Group Reporting when executing Individual Line Item Validation:

Message No. FINCS_MD_CONSUNIT118
No accounting source ledger is maintained for version P11.

Diagnosis:
You haven’t defined an accounting source ledger in the Define Versions configuration activity.

The issue is confusing because:

  • Version P11 is a planning version and is an extension of version P01

  • In Define Versions, version P11 already has a source ledger assigned

  • The source ledger is consistent with the data stored in ACDOCP

  • Version P01 works correctly, and P11 is derived from it

  • The error occurs only during the execution of Individual Line Item Validation

 

My understanding is that plan versions should retrieve data from ACDOCP (planning) and not from an operational accounting ledger like 0L, so it is unclear why the system still complains about a missing accounting source ledger for P11.

Version P11 is not sourcing data from an accounting ledger.
The plan data is retracted from SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC Planning) into ACDOCP, and the records are correctly stored for version P11.

Has anyone experienced this situation before?

Specifically, I would like to understand:

  • Does Individual Line Item Validation require a source ledger even for plan versions?

  • Are there additional settings required for version extensions (P11 from P01)?

  • Is there any dependency between validation tasks and ledger assignment that is not obvious in configuration?

  • Could this be related to how the version is classified (Actual vs Plan) or how the extension was created?

Any guidance, SAP Notes, or configuration hints would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Re: Create Shipment VT01N tile/Business Catalogue in SAP...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

In addition from previous comments, I could add that:

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the transportation process based on shipment documents (VT01N) from SAP R/3 is not available.

In Cloud Public, transportation can be managed in two standard ways.

Without Transportation Management, outbound deliveries are processed individually. Picking, loading, and goods issue are executed per delivery, with mass processing available via standard Fiori apps. However, there is no transportation document, no delivery consolidation at transport level, and no consolidated printout. Any grouping is performed only from a warehouse execution perspective.

For scenarios that require grouping multiple outbound deliveries, a consolidated transportation document, and alignment between transportation and warehouse execution, Basic Transportation Management (TM) is the SAP-recommended standard solution in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

With Basic TM, outbound deliveries or sales orders generate Freight Units, which represent transportation demand. Multiple Freight Units are then grouped into a Freight Order, which serves as the consolidated transportation document and is the functional Cloud equivalent of the VT01N shipment. Printing is performed at Freight Order level. Warehouse execution in EWM remains delivery-based, but deliveries are logically grouped by Freight Order, enabling better synchronization between picking, loading, and transportation. Mass PGI is supported via standard Fiori apps.

In summary, VT01N and shipment documents are not supported in Cloud Public. For transportation consolidation and document-based planning, Basic Transportation Management with Freight Units and Freight Orders is the standard and recommended approach.

Please check further details on the documents below:

3261640 - Usage of LE-TRA Route and discontinuation of Transportation features of LE-TRA in public cloud - SAP for Me

Solved: #COE KKS01 TM with using EWM in cloud? - SAP Community

Getting support on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Editio... - SAP Community

3332309 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition - Restrictions for the Transportation Management processes - SAP for Me

(2622) Expert Talk: Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition - YouTube

entry.title: Re: Como solucionar No task List Selected IW322
entry.content:
HI,

Please check below points in task list:

1. Task list should be active and relased when the maintenance order is generated

2. Task list should be assigned to maintenance plan

If the issue still persists then create new task list and maintenance plan.

Priyanka Mishra

entry.title: Re: Fiori app - F2173 - Find Maintenance Order and Operation
entry.content:
Hi,

You need to activate Business Function LOG_EAM_CI_13 then run the transaction IW37N and then Order->Carry out mass change ->Change operation data , here you can change personnel number. First try it in the quality system, and if works then proceed.

Priyanka Mishra

entry.title: Re: Catch Weight in SAP EWM
entry.content:
Hi Martine,

Catch Weight Management, by itself, does not trigger the Advanced license for EWM.  There is a list of functions which trigger the Advanced license available in this blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-blog-posts-by-sap/understanding-license-type-basic-vs-advanced-for-sap-extended-warehouse/ba-p/13580547 .

Regads,

Brian

entry.title: Re: Now Available: Certification for SAP Central Finance
entry.content:
Please note that this certification is planned to  be retired as of Dec 31st, 2025. After this date, taking this exam will no longer be possible and, in addition, staying certified will no longer be possible. This certification does not have a successor that would cover the same or similar content. Please consider the following options:
1. If you want to get certified, please choose a different certification. In the Finance area, four certifications are available, as described in this blog post. 
2. If you want to get certified for Central Finance, this will not be possible after Dec 31st, 2025.
3. If you want to stay certified on Central Finance, this will not be possible after Dec 31st, 2025. Your certification badge is valid for one year. If you refresh it at the end of December 2025, it will be valid until end of December 2026. Then it will expire.
4. There is not "stay certified" path that could move your Central Finance certification badge to a different certification badge. If you want to avoid losing your certification degree as such, you need to pass an exam on a different certification. 
5. If you want to learn about Central Finance, please note that a business process overview course for self-paced learning is available on learning.sap.com. This is the direct link: https://learning.sap.com/courses/discovering-the-value-of-sap-s-4hana-central-finance.
